When Poppy suggests he train an apprentice, it seems like the solution to his problems! Until his apprentice starts to surpass his partying skills…/When Smidge accidentally agrees to go with both Milton and Guy to the Troll’s fanciest event, the Hair Ball, she must navigate the difficulties of her situation with help from her friends.

programme.title: Dawn Of The Croods Ep13
programme.desc: Unsolved Mystereep - When Gran's cane and Sandy's bear go missing in the middle of the night, Eep chases down every clue to the first-ever mystery to find the thief.

programme.title: Home: Adventures With Tip And Oh! Ep12
programme.desc: Sitting On Babies / Best Frenemies - Things go very wrong when Tip and Oh watch the Gorg babies at a cheese-themed playland/Captain Smek pretends to be Oh's friend just to ruin his day.

programme.title: Spirit Riding Free S1 Ep12
programme.desc: Lucky And The Deadly Blizzard - When a sudden blizzard hits Miradero, Lucky and Maricela must work together to save the town.

programme.title: Dragons Rescue Riders S1 Ep12
programme.desc: Furious Fun - The Rescue Riders have a "Dragon Day" to show their skills to a young fan, but Aggro skips it to hang out with her new fun -- but reckless -- friends.

programme.title: Tinga Tinga Tales Ep49
programme.desc: Why Mole Lives Underground - You see there was a time when Mole didn't live underground. She had tiny weenie ears where every little sound made her ears hurt. Unfortunately Tinga Tinga could be a very noisy place. Then one night when Elephant's snoring, Jackal's howling and Owl's twit-twooing get too much Mole decides to DIG. She digs and she digs and she digs.... until she finds total quiet. Tales from Africa.

programme.title: Tinga Tinga Tales Ep50
programme.desc: Why Squirrel Gathers Nuts - You see there was a time when Squirrel didn't gather nuts; she was far too busy braiding her bushy tail. Then one day there is very little food in Tinga Tinga and Lion summons all the animals to pull together and help find food for everyone. Squirrel is too busy braiding her tail to join in, but when she finally realises that there is not enough food to go round she races around gathering nuts for all the animals. The thing is she can't stop! Tales from Africa.

programme.title: Noddy Toyland Detective Ep49
programme.desc: The Case Of Bumpy’S Burst Ball - It's a play date afternoon in Toy Green and everyone is there having fun. Noddy has got a new ball for Bumpy to replace his old one that went missing. But when he finds the new ball burst in his secret cupboard he decides to investigate…. without letting Bumpy know what's happened. With Big Ears helping out by keeping Bumpy busy, Noddy and Revs are investigating against the clock to find out who burst the ball. When he finds Bumpy's original ball also burst and hidden in the kennel, he works out that the culprit is Bumpy himself! He hadn't wanted to tell anyone as he thought he'd get into trouble! Noddy reassures him that everything is okay and it's always better to tell the truth! Happily reassured, the little wooden dog happily starts playing again with his friends, using the burst ball as a Frisbee! Way to go, Noddy! Case Closed.

programme.title: Noddy Toyland Detective Ep50
programme.desc: The Case Of The Missing Wings - The fairies are giving a big fairy flying display in Toyland. Fairy Coco is devastated when her wings disappear just before the Flying Display. Queen Sparklewings tells Noddy that the wings will only work for Fairy Coco and if anybody else tries to use them it would be dangerous as they may fall and hurt themselves. Noddy immediately stars to investigate. Following all the clues, he works out that Smartysaurus found the wings after Fairy Coco took them off in the Fairy Garden. And now she's planning on flying with them! Noddy, Bumpy and Revs rush to the DinoHills to save Smartysaurus before she has a nasty accident. The big dinosaur is very excited about flying. Noddy explains that the wings will only work for Fairy Coco and Smartysaurus sadly gives them back. Clever Noddy has an idea though and later that evening, at the flying display, Smartysaurus, Toyland's first flying dinosaur makes her debut – with a little help from the building crane and a big dino-harness! Noddy's saved the day again. Case closed!

programme.title: Guess With Jess Ep49
programme.desc: What’S That Green Hairy Stuff? - Jess and the puppies find some strange green hairy stuff growing under the water barrel. The puppies are scared of it and Jess promises them that he'll find out what it is at once. Hey, that's the big question! Jess thinks the green hairy stuff might be grass. He goes to ask Baa, who's a grass expert. Baa, Billie and Jess compare the green hairy stuff and ordinary grass using Billie's magnifying glass. It isn't grass but it is a plant. Mimi knows all about plants so they go to ask her about the green hairy stuff. She shows them the green hairy tops of carrots but they aren't like Jess's green hairy stuff either. Mimi's sure she's seen this green hairy stuff in other places around the farm. Jess thinks they should look around and see where it grows. There's green hairy stuff growing all over the farm in cool, damp places. Horace knows all about damp cool places. Perhaps he can help! Horace tells them that the green hairy stuff is a plant called moss and it's not scary at all. The puppies agree

programme.title: Guess With Jess Ep50
programme.desc: How Can I Find My Friends? - Jess's friends have planned a special surprise but he can't find any of them to find out what it is! How can he find his friends? Hey, that's the Big Question! He finds a trail of Willow's hoof prints but they stop at a puddle. Then they follow a trail of wool from Baa but that stops too. They find a walking haystack but it turns out to be Mimi. Jess is baffled. He can't find anyone else! Mimi helps him realise that he followed clues which led him to her but before Jess can ask her anything else she rushes off. Hmm, thinks Jess, maybe if we follow the clues we found earlier they might lead us to our friends and the special surprise. Jess, Joey and Jinx follow the clues and finds all of their friends waiting for them at a special “Follow the Clues” surprise picnic! Jess found his friends by following the clues AND he's answered the Big Question! Yippety Yay!

programme.title: Rupert Bear S1 Ep32
programme.desc: Rupert And The Moon Adventure - With the sun low in the sky, Rupert waves to Ping Pong, Bill, Edward and Ming as they join him at his cottage. They are all going to stay up late to see something very special – an eclipse of the moon. Bill is just explaining what an eclipse is when Raggety arrives. In his impatience, he does not want to wait for the moon to rise. He wants to see it straight away. Raggety does elf magic to see the moon at once but promptly vanishes. The others think he is playing a trick and hiding from them, but when Bill looks through the telescope, keen to see the start of the eclipse he gets a shock. Raggety has got his wish to see the moon. His magic has taken him there! How will Rupert and friends get him back down before the eclipse shrinks the moon down to nothing? It is a race against time to save their little elf friend.

programme.title: Raa Raa The Noisy Lion Ep31
programme.desc: Catch Me If You Can - All the animals are having a nap. But Raa Raa and Ooo Ooo aren't tired and want to play… will they have enough energy to last until everyone else wakes up?

programme.title: Raa Raa The Noisy Lion Ep32
programme.desc: Raa Raa'S Whistle Worries - Raa Raa is determined that he can copy all the noises in the Jingly Jangly Jungle… until he hears Topsy whistling. Try as he might, Raa Raa just can't whistle. All his jungle friends help Raa Raa to learn to whistle.

programme.title: Postman Pat Delivery Service Ep5
programme.desc: Postman Pat’S Pancake Party - Pat must deliver eggs, milk, flour and butter to Greendale for the annual Pancake Race. But when Michael mixes all the ingredients together, Pat finds that he instead has to deal with a mixing bowl full to the brim with pancake mix... Meanwhile in Greendale, Sara's attempts at pancake-tossing aren't going well and she soon loses her pancake under the wheels of PC Selby's car. Even worse, Ted Glen's amazing Pancake Machine has run out of mix so Sara won't be able to run the race unless Pat can get to Greendale on time... But Pat gets waylaid by Alf's cows and the pancake mix ends up all over the road. Pat hurries back to Pencaster but Michael now only has butter and flour so Pat has to go and get eggs from Nisha and even some milk from Rosie the goat! With the race about to start, Pat arrives just in time with all the ingredients necessary for Ted to make Sara a fresh pancake. SDS Mission accomplished!

programme.title: Postman Pat Delivery Service Ep6
programme.desc: Postman Pat And The Runaway Remote - Pat doesn't realise today's Special Delivery, a super all-in-one remote control, is quite as powerful as it is! As Jess falls asleep on the buttons, machines all around Pencaster start going haywire. Waiting for the remote, Charlie and Julian are installing a futuristic 'Shop a Bot 3000' robot sales assistant for Mrs Goggins, but they make the mistake of turning it on before the controller arrives. Pat struggles to make his delivery before the shop robot does too much damage!

programme.title: Fifi And The Flowertots Ep83
programme.desc: Fifi'S Pancake Fun - Fifi and Pip are busy making pancakes. But every time they flip one it disappears, where could they be going?

programme.desc: Hiccups - Froga gets a terrible hiccup, each of her friends come up with creative solutions to help her to get rid of it. No matter how hard they try, though, the hiccups put their patience and good humor to the test!

programme.desc: The Comic Badge - Duggee is reading the Squirrels one of his favourite comics. They eagerly want to know the ending, but the comic was discontinued. Luckily Duggee has the comic badge!

programme.title: Go Jetters (S2) Ep17
programme.desc: Christmas Island, Indian Ocean - The Go Jetters snap into action as Glitch seeks some festive cheer on Christmas Island.

programme.title: Go Jetters (S2) Ep16
programme.desc: Gua Rusa, Borneo - When Grandmaster Glitch discovers his Halloween pumpkin isn't as big as the Grimbots' one, he goes in search of some fertilizer to help it grow.

programme.title: Bluey (S1) Ep7
programme.desc: Bbq - It's lunchtime on Bluey's deck! But the BBQ needs a salad, so Bingo's relaxing sit-down will have to wait until she finds every colour of capsicum her cousins asked for!

programme.title: Bluey (S1) Ep6
programme.desc: The Weekend - At the weekend, Bluey and Bingo are playing in the garden with Dad. But Bingo gets upset when she discovers a walking leaf insect and Dad doesn't notice.

programme.title: Andy's Prehistoric Adventures (S1) Ep16
programme.desc: Gastornis & Egg - Andy travels 49 million years back in time to find out what colour the eggs of a giant prehistoric bird were and must protect a chick against a colony of supersized ants.

programme.title: Grace's Amazing Machines (S1) Ep6
programme.desc: Racing Machines - Grace drives a rally car in the forest, shows off some incredible racing trucks and then has an actual race in a Stoxkart!

programme.title: Swashbuckle (S8) Ep11
programme.desc: Never Eat Soggy Waffles - Captain Captain fancies some waffles for her tea and sends the pirates to fetch some for her from her secret stockpile. She hands over a map and compass to Sandy and Seaweed, but the pirates don't know which way is North, South, East and West.

programme.title: Hey Duggee (S3) Ep33
programme.desc: The Babysitting Badge - Duggee has a job to do outside of the Clubhouse. But who will look after the Squirrels? King Tiger of course, he has his Babysitting Badge. But then the Squirrels end up babysitting King Tiger!

programme.title: Hey Duggee (S3) Ep31
programme.desc: The A Cappella Badge - The Squirrels are inspired to learn how to sing a cappella style after hearing a famous bird quartet singing in a nearby tree.

programme.title: Hey Duggee (S3) Ep30
programme.desc: The Topiary Badge - When the Squirrels see Duggee practicing his impressive Topiary skills they are keen to try some of their own - and promptly put their new talents into practice in order to tame some very wild woods!

programme.title: Go Jetters (S2) Ep15
programme.desc: Go Jet Academy: Wind Power - The Go Jetters race to save Glitch when his kite flies too close to the Academy wind farm.

programme.title: Go Jetters (S2) Ep14
programme.desc: Bullet Train, Japan - All aboard for a high-speed adventure, as the Go Jetters visit Japan's Bullet Train.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends (S14) Ep10

programme.desc: Donkey Jump - Sarah & Duck try to help Donkey get his jumping confidence back by building a surprise for him in their back garden.

programme.title: Nelly and Nora (S1) Ep42
programme.desc: Nelly's Hair - The humidity makes Nelly's hair puff up so Nora helps her calm it down.

programme.title: Charlie and Lola (S3) Ep15
programme.desc: I Would Like to Actually Keep It - Lola finds a toy rabbit near school and insists that they take it home, but Charlie is determined to find out who it belongs to and return it.

programme.title: Dinopaws (S1) Ep25
programme.desc: The Thing We Looked Through - The Dinopaws invent a new game called Look-at-Me, but they break the toy they are playing with.

programme.title: Dinopaws (S1) Ep24
programme.desc: The Thing That Broke - The Dinopaws invent the best game ever - bigging and rounding.

programme.title: Bluey (S1) Ep5

programme.title: Hey Duggee (S3) Ep29

programme.title: Hey Duggee (S3) Ep28
programme.desc: The Round Up Badge - The Squirrels go on the trail of a lost herd of cattle with Duggee and his old pal Rodeo Horse, who teaches them how to be cowhands... and earn their Round Up Badges in the process!

programme.title: Hey Duggee (S3) Ep27

programme.title: Razor
programme.desc: CGTN's brand new science and technology show, covering cutting edge developments from all over the world. RAZOR will show you the world's most powerful laser and the world's smallest anti-cancer treatment. It will take you from the weird world of quantum computing to the boundaries of the cosmos. An international team of reporters will follow the guidance of Occam's Razor - the principle that the simplest explanation is the best one. RAZOR will show that we are already ""living in the future"!

programme.desc: Michelle and Teo learn about bonsai trees, paint with pine needle brushes, make homemade paper and visit Owl in her very own tree house café! Through the windows learn how wooden spoons are made at a timber mill.

programme.title: Belonging(s) - Work: From Laundry Workers To "Slashies" S1 Ep1
programme.desc: We look at a long scroll depicting early Chinese Australians as laundry workers among others. Plus we see a drum kit used by the late Alma Quan, a musician who coached debutante dance routines.

programme.title: Pandemic Warriors - A Chance to Return Home S2 Ep3
programme.desc: With 500 people leaving Nepal daily, social entrepreneur Bina Shrestha is determined to create local opportunities, one eco-friendly brick at a time. COVID slowed her down but with Australian backing she is not giving up.

programme.desc: Dean comes to Mia's aide. Ziggy and Tane try to move on. Christian's plans for Tori begin to unfold.

programme.title: Back Roads - Hebel, QLD S8 Ep11
programme.desc: Heather Ewart travels to the border town of Hebel in south-west Queensland, a little place with a big heart, where folk look for a silver lining in the toughest of times.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: In September 2022, Fabio Luisi was appointed chief conductor of the NHK Symphony Orchestra. He shares his thoughts about music and his work as a conductor thus far.

programme.title: Cycle Around Japan Highlights
programme.desc: With the pandemic limiting travel, we're sending our cyclists to film themselves on local rides. In this episode Michael Rice explores the area around his new hometown in Kanagawa, near Tokyo.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Learn Japanese From The News
programme.desc: We listen to a story about centenarians in Japan. This year the number of people aged 100 and over exceeded 90,000 for the first time, marking a record high for the 52nd consecutive year.

programme.title: Easy Japanese
programme.desc: #19 I'd like a pair of gloves. / Tell store clerks what you want by putting "ga hoshiin desu ga" after the name of the item.

programme.title: Bosai: Be Prepared
programme.desc: Iwate is the prefecture with the largest number of natural disasters monuments. We meet people who pass on the lessons of past disasters in this region that was devastated by the 2011 tsunami.

programme.title: Dining With The Chef Mini
programme.desc: Featured recipe: Yaki-udon with Yuzukosho/ Learn about easy, delicious, and healthy cooking with Chef Rika in five minutes!

programme.title: Newsroom Tokyo
programme.desc: This program gives you comprehensive coverage of events in Japan and Asia. It explains the day's developments and what is behind them.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Pritzker Prize-winning Ban Shigeru is known for his commitment to disaster relief efforts, such as his work to improve living conditions at shelters. He talks about helping Ukrainian refugees.

programme.title: Ukiyoe Edo-Life: Edo Aquatics
programme.desc: We go out onto a river where pleasure seekers take in an aquatics show. At first glance a display of rag-tag theatricality, the perform-ers are actually practicing a centuries-old form of swimming.

programme.title: NHK Documentary
programme.desc: How does life as a journalist change when your own country becomes a war zone? We follow Ukrainian reporters working under pressure to document the horrors of war and keep the public informed.

programme.title: Fukushima Time-Lapse 5Min.
programme.desc: 10 years on from the 2011 tsunami and nuclear disaster, time-lapse creator Shimizu Daisuke seeks out the undiminished beauty of Fukushima. This time we focus on forests.

programme.desc: In Kuzuu, a leading area for quicklime production, frescos are being painted in an effort to enliven the town. One such fresco covers an entire wall of the Kuzuu Folk Art & Crafts Museum.

programme.desc: Pemain-pemain bola sepak tempatan menunjukkan kemahiran memasak mereka dan berkongsi pengalaman serta aksi memasak yang pasti mencuit hati. Rancangan ini dapat memberi Inspirasi kepada peminat yang menonton

programme.title: Sensasi Bola Ep21
programme.desc: Sensasi Bola merupakan satu program bual bicara berdurasi setengah jam bersama pemain bola sepak, selebriti, jurulatih dan peminat sebagai tetamu undangan setiap minggu. Antara topik menarik yang akan dikupas adalah isu mengenai bola sepak tempatan dan antarabangsa, temubual ekslusif bersama lagenda bola sepak, tips kesihatan serta isu semasa yang menjadi perbualan masa kini.

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Grasso vs. Araujo
programme.desc: Prelims - Since moving to the flyweight division, Mexico’s Alexa Grasso has been unstopabble, defeating Ji Yeon Kim, Maycee Barber and Joanne Wood. On October 15 at the APEX in Las Vegas, the Top Five ranked Grasso will make her case for a 125-pound title shot when she battles Brazil’s Viviane Araujo in the five-round main event of UFC Fight Night. Also holding down a spot in the flyweight rankings, Araujo has already faced former world titleholders Alexis Davis, Jessica Eye, Roxanne Modafferi and Katlyn Chookagian, and she expects a win over Grasso will earn her a crack at the crown

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Grasso vs. Araujo
programme.desc: Main Event - Since moving to the flyweight division, Mexico’s Alexa Grasso has been unstopabble, defeating Ji Yeon Kim, Maycee Barber and Joanne Wood. On October 15 at the APEX in Las Vegas, the Top Five ranked Grasso will make her case for a 125-pound title shot when she battles Brazil’s Viviane Araujo in the five-round main event of UFC Fight Night. Also holding down a spot in the flyweight rankings, Araujo has already faced former world titleholders Alexis Davis, Jessica Eye, Roxanne Modafferi and Katlyn Chookagian, and she expects a win over Grasso will earn her a crack at the crown

Antara topik menarik yang akan dikupas adalah isu mengenai bola sepak tempatan dan antarabangsa, temubual ekslusif bersama lagenda bola sepak, tips kesihatan serta isu semasa yang menjadi perbualan masa kini.

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Grasso vs. Araujo
programme.desc: Prelims - Since moving to the flyweight division, Mexico’s Alexa Grasso has been unstopabble, defeating Ji Yeon Kim, Maycee Barber and Joanne Wood. On October 15 at the APEX in Las Vegas, the Top Five ranked Grasso will make her case for a 125-pound title shot when she battles Brazil’s Viviane Araujo in the five-round main event of UFC Fight Night. Also holding down a spot in the flyweight rankings, Araujo has already faced former world titleholders Alexis Davis, Jessica Eye, Roxanne Modafferi and Katlyn Chookagian, and she expects a win over Grasso will earn her a crack at the crown

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Grasso vs. Araujo
programme.desc: Main Event - Since moving to the flyweight division, Mexico’s Alexa Grasso has been unstopabble, defeating Ji Yeon Kim, Maycee Barber and Joanne Wood. On October 15 at the APEX in Las Vegas, the Top Five ranked Grasso will make her case for a 125-pound title shot when she battles Brazil’s Viviane Araujo in the five-round main event of UFC Fight Night. Also holding down a spot in the flyweight rankings, Araujo has already faced former world titleholders Alexis Davis, Jessica Eye, Roxanne Modafferi and Katlyn Chookagian, and she expects a win over Grasso will earn her a crack at the crown
